comments.body:
BTW, supporting build on Windows officially will need some considerable changes to convert some scripts from bash to cmd, and it will make our life more difficult.

We don't use Windows for a release anyway so I think it's fine. As long as we are able to test SparkR on Windows via AppVeyor (which CRAN requires), I guess we're good.

Also, I think we have a small promise that (https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/123eb58d61ad7c7ebe540f1634088696a3cc85bc/docs/index.md):

> Spark runs on both Windows and UNIX-like systems (e.g. Linux, Mac OS). It's easy to run locally on one machine --- all you need is to have java installed on your system PATH, or the JAVA_HOME environment variable pointing to a Java installation.

It _runs_ on Windows but I don't think it means we support to _build_ officially.
